p: Among monoterpenoids, bornyl acetate (4.6%) and Î±-pinene (2.9%) were the most representative compounds. The presence of aromatic aldehydes, such as 2,3,6-trimethyl benzaldehyde, is considered a hallmark of several Ferulago species [ 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23]. It is worth mentioning that these compounds are formed during distillation from the cleavage and molecular rearrangement of ferulol-type monoterpenoids [ 19].
